<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The type MachO::macho&#95;load&#95;command is defined in llvm/BinaryFormat/MachO.h</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and it is a union of all the structs corresponding to various load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// commands.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/loadcommand/#a521ae30565359d9c67ad94fed18ce660"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/unions/llvm/macho/macho-load-command">MachO::macho&#95;load&#95;command</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/loadcommand/#a521ae30565359d9c67ad94fed18ce660">MachOLoadCommand</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The raw content of the payload of the load command (located right after the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// corresponding struct). In some cases it is either empty or can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// copied-over without digging into its structure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/loadcommand/#ae25df5c778a8f3a989d3f384ca9fc116"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/loadcommand/#ae25df5c778a8f3a989d3f384ca9fc116">Payload</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Some load commands can contain (inside the payload) an array of sections,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// though the contents of the sections are stored separately. The struct</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Section describes only sections&#39; metadata and where to find the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/relocationinfo/#a05185c842272a64bbe33c528dff7247c">Info</a>.r&#95;word1 &gt;&gt; 8;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(SymbolNum &lt; (1 &lt;&lt; 24) &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;SymbolNum out of range&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The location of the rebase info inside the binary is described by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LC&#95;DYLD&#95;INFO load command. Dyld rebases an image whenever dyld loads it at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an address different from its preferred address.  The rebase information is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a stream of byte sized opcodes whose symbolic names start with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// REBASE&#95;OPCODE&#95;. Conceptually the rebase information is a table of tuples:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &lt;seg-index, seg-offset, type&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The opcodes are a compressed way to encode the table by only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// encoding when a column changes.  In addition simple patterns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// like &quot;every n&#39;th offset for m times&quot; can be encoded in a few</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/rebaseinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/rebaseinfo">RebaseInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// At the moment we do not parse this info (and it is simply copied over),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but the proper support will be added later.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/rebaseinfo/#ad3cf983e43e06639add48724b964d016"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/rebaseinfo/#ad3cf983e43e06639add48724b964d016">Opcodes</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The location of the bind info inside the binary is described by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LC&#95;DYLD&#95;INFO load command. Dyld binds an image during the loading process,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// if the image requires any pointers to be initialized to symbols in other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// images. The bind information is a stream of byte sized opcodes whose</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// symbolic names start with BIND&#95;OPCODE&#95;. Conceptually the bind information is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a table of tuples: &lt;seg-index, seg-offset, type, symbol-library-ordinal,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// symbol-name, addend&gt; The opcodes are a compressed way to encode the table by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// only encoding when a column changes.  In addition simple patterns like for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// runs of pointers initialized to the same value can be encoded in a few</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/bindinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/bindinfo">BindInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// At the moment we do not parse this info (and it is simply copied over),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but the proper support will be added later.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/bindinfo/#a7e06e6dded2b6ab6173c867788cd8ce2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/bindinfo/#a7e06e6dded2b6ab6173c867788cd8ce2">Opcodes</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The location of the weak bind info inside the binary is described by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LC&#95;DYLD&#95;INFO load command. Some C++ programs require dyld to unique symbols</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// so that all images in the process use the same copy of some code/data. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// step is done after binding. The content of the weak&#95;bind info is an opcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// stream like the bind&#95;info.  But it is sorted alphabetically by symbol name.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This enable dyld to walk all images with weak binding information in order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and look for collisions.  If there are no collisions, dyld does no updating.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// That means that some fixups are also encoded in the bind&#95;info.  For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instance, all calls to &quot;operator new&quot; are first bound to libstdc++.dylib</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// using the information in bind&#95;info.  Then if some image overrides operator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// new that is detected when the weak&#95;bind information is processed and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// call to operator new is then rebound.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/weakbindinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/weakbindinfo">WeakBindInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// At the moment we do not parse this info (and it is simply copied over),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but the proper support will be added later.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/weakbindinfo/#aea259cd75b7493da0eb265b966f0bc41"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/weakbindinfo/#aea259cd75b7493da0eb265b966f0bc41">Opcodes</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The location of the lazy bind info inside the binary is described by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LC&#95;DYLD&#95;INFO load command. Some uses of external symbols do not need to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bound immediately. Instead they can be lazily bound on first use.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// lazy&#95;bind contains a stream of BIND opcodes to bind all lazy symbols. Normal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// use is that dyld ignores the lazy&#95;bind section when loading an image.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Instead the static linker arranged for the lazy pointer to initially point</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to a helper function which pushes the offset into the lazy&#95;bind area for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// symbol needing to be bound, then jumps to dyld which simply adds the offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to lazy&#95;bind&#95;off to get the information on what to bind.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/lazybindinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/lazybindinfo">LazyBindInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/lazybindinfo/#a2d32b13b4857e04203d0307f0faa3af5"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/lazybindinfo/#a2d32b13b4857e04203d0307f0faa3af5">Opcodes</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The location of the export info inside the binary is described by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LC&#95;DYLD&#95;INFO load command. The symbols exported by a dylib are encoded in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// trie.  This is a compact representation that factors out common prefixes. It</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// also reduces LINKEDIT pages in RAM because it encodes all information (name,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// address, flags) in one small, contiguous range. The export area is a stream</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of nodes.  The first node sequentially is the start node for the trie. Nodes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for a symbol start with a uleb128 that is the length of the exported symbol</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// information for the string so far. If there is no exported symbol, the node</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// starts with a zero byte. If there is exported info, it follows the length.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// First is a uleb128 containing flags. Normally, it is followed by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a uleb128 encoded offset which is location of the content named</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by the symbol from the mach&#95;header for the image.  If the flags</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is EXPORT&#95;SYMBOL&#95;FLAGS&#95;REEXPORT, then following the flags is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a uleb128 encoded library ordinal, then a zero terminated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// UTF8 string.  If the string is zero length, then the symbol</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is re-export from the specified dylib with the same name.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If the flags is EXPORT&#95;SYMBOL&#95;FLAGS&#95;STUB&#95;AND&#95;RESOLVER, then following</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the flags is two uleb128s: the stub offset and the resolver offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The stub is used by non-lazy pointers.  The resolver is used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by lazy pointers and must be called to get the actual address to use.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// After the optional exported symbol information is a byte of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// how many edges (0-255) that this node has leaving it,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// followed by each edge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each edge is a zero terminated UTF8 of the addition chars</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the symbol, followed by a uleb128 offset for the node that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// edge points to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/exportinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/exportinfo">ExportInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/exportinfo/#aa185fe5f6e7a83126aecc73067527a1f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/exportinfo/#aa185fe5f6e7a83126aecc73067527a1f">Trie</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/linkdata"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/linkdata">LinkData</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/linkdata/#a14ca0d578aa8b8beddf8b28369c871f7"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/macho/linkdata/#a14ca0d578aa8b8beddf8b28369c871f7">Data</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if present.</span></CodeLine>
